segment.source: Export an AppLocker policy from a GPO (Windows 10)
segment.target: Export an AppLocker policy from a GPO (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to export an AppLocker policy from a Group Policy Object (GPO) so that it can be modified.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to export an AppLocker policy from a Group Policy Object (GPO) so that it can be modified.

segment.source: Export an AppLocker policy from a GPO
segment.target: Export an AppLocker policy from a GPO

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to export an AppLocker policy from a Group Policy Object (GPO) so that it can be modified.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to export an AppLocker policy from a Group Policy Object (GPO) so that it can be modified.

segment.source: Updating an AppLocker policy that is currently enforced in your production environment can have unintended results.
segment.target: Updating an AppLocker policy that is currently enforced in your production environment can have unintended results.

segment.source: Therefore, export the policy from the GPO and update the rule or rules by using AppLocker on your AppLocker reference device
segment.target: Therefore, export the policy from the GPO and update the rule or rules by using AppLocker on your AppLocker reference device

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must have the Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must have the Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.

segment.source: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.
segment.target: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.

segment.source: Export the policy from the GPO
segment.target: Export the policy from the GPO

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), open the GPO that you want to edit.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), open the GPO that you want to edit.

segment.source: In the console tree under Computer ConfigurationPoliciesWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsApplication Control Policies, click AppLocker.
segment.target: In the console tree under Computer ConfigurationPoliciesWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsApplication Control Policies, click AppLocker.

segment.source: Right-click AppLocker, and then click Export Policy.
segment.target: Right-click AppLocker, and then click Export Policy.

segment.source: In the Export Policy dialog box, type a name for the exported policy (for example, the name of the GPO), select a location to save the policy, and then click Save.
segment.target: In the Export Policy dialog box, type a name for the exported policy (for example, the name of the GPO), select a location to save the policy, and then click Save.

segment.source: The AppLocker dialog box will notify you of how many rules were exported.
segment.target: The AppLocker dialog box will notify you of how many rules were exported.
